mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Burwell Bassett, Jr. to Fanny Bassett Washington, 1794 August 17
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bassett, Burwell, 1764-1841
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Eltham. Bettsy [wife?] has been very ill all summer, but has lately been revived by the copious use of wine and bark -- advises Fanny not to go to town in middle of summer, because of ague and fever -- brother John and family went up country to Mr. Robert Lewis's for their health -- Mrs. Lyons ill. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, integral cover, docketed by Frances Washington, mutilated, laminated, watermark. Name on original manuscript appears as "Burwell Bassett."
